intro: Dolicholus calycinus, commonly known as the rock fig, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the Moraceae family, which includes figs and mulberries. The plant is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves and produces small, greenish-white flowers that develop into edible fig-like fruits. Dolicholus calycinus thrives in rocky, arid environments and is often found growing on cliffs or in dry, sandy soils. Its botanical features make it an important plant in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
